title: Johnson & Johnson Files Suit Against Alleged HIV-Drug Counterfeiters; Gilead Sciences initiated similar complaint against dozens of defendants
text:
In a statement, J&J said that HIV medicines had become a focus of illegal counterfeiting in recent years. The company said it filed its lawsuit after its investigation found criminal activity involving unauthorized distributors.

Counterfeit medications can include fake pills, the wrong medication or genuine drugs that have faked documentation or altered packaging.

The lawsuit follows a similar complaint filed by Gilead Sciences Inc., which accused dozens of defendants of taking part in a network that led to more than $250 million of counterfeit HIV medications being sold to pharmacies over two years.

Write to Corinne Ramey at Corinne.Ramey@wsj.com and Joseph Walker at joseph.walker@wsj.com

Johnson & Johnson Files Suit Against Alleged HIV-Drug Counterfeiters
